New Records: Andre Russell took his 50th T20 international wicket.
Key Match Events: Roston Chase scored 50 runs, including six fours and a six.
Sese Bau scored a half-century for Papua New Guinea.
Andre Russell took the 50th wicket of his T20 international career.
Alei Nao struck in the second over, removing Johnson Charles lbw for a duck.
Nicholas Pooran added a valuable 27 runs.
West Indies found themselves on 97/5 with just four overs remaining.
Roston Chase and Andre Russell completed the job to give West Indies a winning start.
Post-Match Reflections: Roston Chase expressed his pleasure in starting the tournament with a win and taking it home for the team.
Papua New Guinea captain Assad Vala was pleased with his team's fight and getting wickets at key moments despite the loss.
